intro: Hieracium adenocephalum, commonly known as the glandular-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, producing small achenes as seeds. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
